intro: Capsella prorepens var. yezoensis, commonly known as the Yezo mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, ovate leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological and horticultural studies.
